name: Statistics for Social Good
body:
The inaugural Statistics for Social Good topic-contributed session will be held during the 2016 [Joint Statistical Meetings](https://www.amstat.org/meetings/jsm/2016/) (Jul 30 - Aug 4 in Chicago). The session is sponsored by the [American Statistical Association](http://www.amstat.org/)'s Social Statistics section.

###Call for presenters
We are soliciting contributions for 20 minute presentations on research that fits the theme of statistics for social good. Broadly construed, this could be statistics-related social good applications, or new statistical methods or theory of particular interest for social good applications. New, previously published, and in progress research will all be considered. 

###Submission process
Email [ht395 AT cornell DOT edu](mailto:ht395@cornell.edu) an abstract (1200 characters limit) and optionally, any supporting materials (e.g. a paper in progress). 

Deadline: end of day _Saturday, Jan 9, 2016_

###Further Info
Selected presenters will have the opportunity to publish their paper in conference [proceedings](https://www.amstat.org/meetings/jsm/2016/proceedings.cfm) if they wish. This conference's proceedings are not exclusive. Note that by conference [participation guidelines](https://www.amstat.org/meetings/jsm/2016/guidelines.cfm), each participant can present no more than one paper during the conference. However, the presenter need not be the first author on the paper.

### Organizers
[Sarah Tan](shftan.github.io) (Cornell University), [Rayid Ghani](http://www.rayidghani.com/) (University of Chicago, Data Science for Social Good)

###Important Dates
January 9, 2016 - Abstract submission deadline

January 14, 2016 - Notification of acceptance

May 17, 2016 - Proof of work in progress (e.g. paper in progress, presentation slides) deadline

July 30 to August 4, 2016 - Conference

### Contact Info
Please email [ht395 AT cornell DOT edu](mailto:ht395@cornell.edu) with any questions.
